I'm a <b>cognitive scientist</b>, <b>game enthusiast</b>, and <b>gambling researcher</b>. I have a PhD and the title of <a href="https://www.helsinki.fi/en/about-us/people/researchers-and-teachers/docents">docent</a href> in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cognitive_science" target="_blank">cognitive science</a href> from the University of Helsinki where I used to work as a university lecturer. I also have the title of docent in the study of games and well-being at Tampere University. Currently I work as a senior researcher at the Finnish Institute for Health and Welfare on gambling harm prevention. 



I've published 73 scientific papers (63 peer-reviewed) on topics covering, but not limited to, emotions and decision-making, poker expertise, gambling, psychology of deception, personality, memory, and moral psychology of robotics. I'm interested and deeply involved in statistics, data wrangling, analysis and visualization.

See my research profiles at <a href="https://researchportal.helsinki.fi/en/persons/jussi-petteri-palomäki" target="_blank">University of Helsinki</a href> and <a href="https://scholar.google.fi/citations?user=oKOImCYAAAAJ&hl=fi&oi=ao" target="_blank">Google Scholar</a href>.
